description: When attempting to use DuckTyping with a socket, an error is thrown due to a type mismatch. The code is attempting to assign a socket object to a variable that is expecting a type of object that is not a socket. This type mismatch causes the code to fail to compile and throws
code:
# Define a class
class MyClass:
    def __init__(self, value):
        self.value = value

# Create an instance of MyClass
my_instance = MyClass(5)

# Create a socket object
import socket
